body.description: Welcome to the Gillette's Sensor2 family! Looking for a simple yet reliable razor? Gillette has something for you. Gillette Sensor2 provides a comfortable shave for everyone. A great shave is within your grasp with this Gillette Sensor2 Plus Pivoting Head Men's Disposable Razor featuring a pivoting razor head, lubrastrip for glide and a soft ultragrip handle for great control. All Sensor2 disposable razors have twin blades that deliver a close, comfortable shave and are coated with chromium to make them last longer, so you don't have to reach for a new one every time you shave. When it comes to blades, two is simply better than one. Gillette's Sensor2 has twin blades that provide you with a close, comfortable shave and let you use the razor that much longer. Also, the Gillette Sensor2 disposable razors don't require any refills; just use and replace when you're ready for a new one. This Gillette Sensor2 razor pack features a pivoting head that adjusts to the contour of your face, a water-activated lubrastrip that makes the blades glide smoothly across your skin, and a soft ultragrip razor handle for great control. This is all to turn shaving into a simple, comfortable experience. Sensor2 is a simple way to get a great shave!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Sensor2 Plus Pivot Disposable Razors Gillette Sensor2 Plus Men’s Disposable Razor (formerly CustomPlus) features a Chromium coating, for long lasting twin comfort blades. The water-activated Lubrastrip provides instant lubrication for extraordinary comfort. Complete with a Soft Ultragrip handle for great control. Its Pivoting Head adjusts to the contours of your face. Get up to 5 shaves.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Back to Basics
reviews.reviewText: Let's face it (see what I did there?): Most razor companies won't be happy until they find a way to fit 13 blades on the head of a cartridge so they can charge $20 each. We've been told over the years "the more blades the smoother the shave". They even created cool little animations showing defenseless little hairs being decapitated at pore level. This may be great for those of us who have very stubborn stubble and require our shave to be so close that a five o'clock shadow doesn't show up until 2023. However, most human beings don't need more than one blade. We've been led to believe that this is a necessity because our parents and our grandparents and our great-grandparents used a single blade and that was simply archaic if not straight out of the Neanderthal age. We might as well be shaving with a hunting knife like Crocodile Dundee if we're using anything less than 4 blades. I'm here to tell you that may not be your case. If you have hair that is anything like mine, even on the top of your head and in other places on your body, you don't need more than two blades at the most.If you've all but given up on replacement cartridges and quadruple blade infusions and machs and turbos and all that other crap, maybe it's time to go back to basics and try regular old disposable twin blade razors. Worst case scenario if you don't like them you can always give them to a family member.And let's not discount the ladies who enjoy shaving with what is supposed to be a men's razor. Nobody says these have to be specifically for men. If I can shave every part of my body with them, so can you.Also, just because these things are disposable doesn't mean they aren't sharp as hell. I will keep buying these until they stop making them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Disposable Razor Made!
reviews.reviewText: This is the BEST 2 bladed razor made. I dislike the "157 blade" razors in the market place. I find that the 3,4 and 5 blade razors give no closer or better shave and are cumbersome to shave with, as you can't get into the small areas around the nose and mouth... and I won't buy them. I used to buy these at Costco, but they got sucked into the "157 blade" razors, so I've turned to Amazon and I order them in bulk.Just as a foot note: After not being able to get two-bladed razors, out of frustration I decided to go back to basics. I ordered a Parker 99R double edge safety razor (the kind that my grandfather used -- yes they still make those) from Amazon for $30 bucks. I did not care for the blades it came with, so I read some reviews and ordered Feather Double Blades for replacements (the best made). Cost...wait for it...50 blades will run you $14.35 on Amazon Prime. I use a blade a week, so that will last a year!In addition, I ordered Williams Mug Shaving Soap (Amazon Prime $6.09 for 3 bars -- lasts me about a year) , a shaving cup (AKStore Men's Durable Shave Soap Cup / $6.99 on Amazon Prime). I splurged a little of a genuine silver tipped badger shaving brush, as I recall about $40.00 on Amazon. Now, I don't add to the over 100 million shaving cans that are in landfills every year, let alone the cost savings.There was a little bit a learning curve to using a safety razor without cutting myself to death, but now I do it as easily as a disposable razor. The big thing, it is THE CLOSEST AND BEST SHAVE OF MY LIFE!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BEST SHAVE OF MY LIFE - I AM 58
reviews.reviewText: A few weeks ago I had gone back to the old system of the metal handle that opens up for you to insert a disposable double-edged razor blade. It was a lot cheaper than the modern plastic all-in-one disposables and I had used it until the age of 19 or so. The merkur handle was fine but believe it or not the blades (no matter what brand) were way too sharp and shredded my face - lots of blood and cuts where I had NEVER been cut with a modern plastic disposable (Maybe now that I'm older my skin is thinner - I don't know). I toughed it out for over a month thinking I just had to get use to it but I finally saw it wasn't me. I mean these things were surgical scalpels! And I used great shaving cream and soaked my face first with hot water. Even if I cleaned the blood up perfectly I would still find VERY noticeable dried blood spots a couple of hours later that looked awful. Far, far, far more bleeding than I ever had with any disposable. So I went to Amazon and grabbed these as they were a nice balance of high reviews at a decent price. OMG. Truly the best shave I ever had. I hadn't shaved in 4 days and I didn't even use shaving cream (I hate using it cos I can't tell exactly where the blades are landing - I have a goatee). I am staying with these for as long as they are available. With the double-edged too-sharp system I had DREADED shaving. With these I give it no more thought than getting my breakfast. Go Gillette and Amazon!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great value for the money.
reviews.reviewText: I've used these for years but now I'm switching to Gilette comfort plus 3. These work good but sometimes left cuts on my skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works for Me
reviews.reviewText: I have a beard and the two blade works better for me shaving my neck and cheek line. I get about 4-5 uses before disposing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gillette vs Shick
reviews.reviewText: I have used Gillette couple razors for years and have always loved the shave I gey.Late last year I went to reorder and they were not avaiable. So I bought Shick double blade. Terrible shave! Will never use Shock again!Gillette you have the best!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The ONLY excellent razor Gillette makes.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent shave that is close, comfortable and lasts! Gillette has LOWERED the quality of all of their lower cost razors. I gave away two bags of Gillette disappointments. They have really lowered their quality control. I will make it a point to purchase as many Sensor Plus 2's , before the "genius' at Gillette decide to "improve" this product line too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great value for the price. Definitely recommend these razors for backup purposes and traveling.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product is fine but experience not
reviews.reviewText: Product seems decent quality but seller only sent 1 of 3 packs. Recommend razors not seller thanks

After my fiasco with buying the metal Bic blades I found the Gillette Sensor2 Disposables recommended by Consumer Reports. Much, much better. They are even better than the Bic Original blades. I've been using the same razor for almost two weeks without a nick or a scratch. Very Happy!!
Debería ser 3 paquetes de 10 o 30 piezas, sólo me llegó 1 paquetes de 10....

I've used Mach 3 blades to shave for years and years. But I saw this offer for these 2 bladed razors at less than half the cost of the Mach 3 blades. All I can say is wow! The shave was basically just as good as the Mach 3 - actually I had less skin irritation with one less blade. And it is kinda nice to get a fresh handle instead of having to reuse the same handle that I've used for 10 years, which is getting really worn out. And at less then half the cost, you really can't go wrong. The best way to not cut yourself with any razor is to not push to hard. If you have to push hard to get the razor to cut, your blades are dull, and you should use a new razor.
Great to pack in a travel kit. Cheap too!
